result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Schontelle E Powell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Schontelle E Powell in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Schontelle E Powell.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler Rubenzel in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defense counsel has not received discovery and offer.
Parties informed the Court this case should be retabbed to Domestic Violence Court. 
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 29.
Court ordered matter adjourned to Branch 29.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JWP
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Schontelle E Powell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs appeared by video for Schontelle E Powell.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
